It's a weird interaction, but Twitch is still getting exactly the intended amount of bonus damage from Hurricane: 80% damage on attack split between two nearby targets. Cait used to get this bonus and the additional perk of getting her passive 200%+ damage auto attack twice as frequently, hence why she was an actual abuser of this item.

Caitlyn was an abuse case because on top of getting the standard collateral damage bonus for building Runaan's, she also got a disproportionately large single-target DPS increase, which outperformed intended single-target DPS items and was not an intentional function of the item.

Twitch is a notable user of Runaan's Hurricane because he is able to apply it on top of his innate collateral damage. He's an above-average user of Hurricane for sure, because it builds onto his core strengths, and Hurricane's on-hit interactions synergize well with BorK and his passive + E. These are intentional, straightforward bonuses, and they cater to the type of champion Twitch is and the type of effect Runaan's is supposed to have on a champion's damage output.

Caitlyn was an actual Hurricane abuser, meaning there was a weird interaction that gave her lots of unintended power. This is not the case with Twitch.

Twitch is getting exactly the intended amount of bonus damage from Hurricane: 80% damage on attack split between two nearby targets. Cait used to get this bonus _and_ the additional perk of getting her passive 200%+ damage auto attack twice as frequently.

Vayne had the exact same interaction on Devourer enchant, and they literally removed the item before fixing the interaction.

Cait's interaction with Runaan's was not as extreme as the interactions on Jinx, Kayle, or Twitch. Melting a team one target at a time (like Cait) is fundamentally less toxic than melting an entire team in the time it took Cait to get two headshots with Runaan's.

Twitch is still getting exactly the intended amount of damage from Runaan's that he is supposed to. Anyone ranged champion that picks up the item automatically gets bonus collateral damage on their auto attacks.

Twitch is a notable user of Runaan's Hurricane because he is able to apply it on top of his innate collateral damage. He's an above-average user of Hurricane for sure, because it builds onto his core strengths, and Hurricane's on-hit interactions synergize well with BorK and his passive + E. These are intentional, straightforward bonuses, and they cater to the type of champion Twitch is and the type of effect Runaan's is supposed to have on a champion's damage output. (Runaan's best users are champions like Kog'Maw and Kayle who have lots of on-hit power to amplify with Runaan's.)

Caitlyn was an abuse case because on top of getting the standard collateral damage bonus for building Runaan's, she also got a disproportionately large single-target DPS increase, which outperformed intended single-target DPS items and was not an intentional function of the item.
